titleStmt.title: The vanitie of the eye first beganne for the comfort of a gentlewoman bereaved of her sight, and since vpon occasion enlarged & published for the common good. By George Hakewill Master of Arts, and fellow of Exeter Coll. in Oxford.
titleStmt.author: Hakewill, George, 1578-1649.

titleStmt.title: The vanitie of the eye first beganne for the comfort of a gentlewoman bereaved of her sight, and since vpon occasion enlarged & published for the common good. By George Hakewill Master of Arts, and fellow of Exeter Coll. in Oxford.
titleStmt.author: Hakewill, George, 1578-1649.

editionStmt.edition: The third edition augmented by the author.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Ioseph Barnes, printer to the Vniversitie,

notesStmt.note: The last three leaves are blank.
Running title reads: The vanitie of the eie.
In this edition only there is an extra quire, I¹² , with notes on the text.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
